name: odei
text: In France it is also considered rude not to look disgusted and spit at the waiter after finishing your meal. They are very serious about good food.

text: All I need is clothing and I'm set!

text: http://www.swapmeetdave.com/Humor/Workshop/Trencher.htm

name: featurelessvoid
text: Hell of enormous, yo. You can see it from orbit .

name: andrew_
text: AIIIIIIIIIIIIIIEEEEEEEEEEEEEE!

name: aperson
text: You can also see medium sized shrubs on google maps aerial photos.

name: zem
text: oh classic

name: thescrivener
text:
Dude, Google Maps photos are pretty much all from such as low flying planes. That's about 1/64th of an orbit.
And about 1/256th as cool.

name: featurelessvoid
text: You win this round, Inverse Square Law.

name: rowboat
text: Excellent research trumps the inaccuracy of the claim.

name: dusty
text:
It picked up a fairly large bulldozer without even noticing right away:
http://www.darkroastedblend.com/2006/11/biggest-and-hungriest-machines.html
I actually used to work for the company that built this thing, I was an industrial engineer in the machining group.

name: sargasm
text: When the time comes, that is the machine we will use to kill God.

name: thedudeabides85
text: Slap some 22s on that thing, throw in a few cup holders, and watch as the "emotionally-stunted douchebag" demographic trades in its Hummers for a fleet of Chevy Annihilators.  "This is ooouuuuurr country..."

name: neonfreon
text: A comment left by neonfreon was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by nbgreene, littlecat, illgamesh, Majumbo)

name: pie4me6
text: Ohhh shiiiiiiit!

name: tombsgrave
text:
...In Japan's next construction-machine-themed fighting game, of course.
Alternately, it would make a bitchin' Transformer.

name: hikikomori
text:
And I thought I'd seen the last of the dastardly Bagger 288. Damn you.

But I have to say, that is one Hell of a machine though. IT EATS BULLDOZERS, for Christ's sake.

name: nbgreene
text: can we send that to iraq? i have to think that would help turn things around over there.

name: tekende
text: I don't think they'd even have to really do anything with it. Just have it there with an American flag on it. It'd do the trick just sitting there.

name: dzieger
text:
Wow. I remember a garish sci-fi paperback cover, circa the early 60s (I'm guessing), depicting a giant, bladed disk, much like the one on the business end of that digger, tearing through a city.

Mind you, the one in the illustration had a diameter greater than the height of the skyscrapers it was shredding, and gave me nightmares as a kid. Still, having seen that photo, I'm afraid to go to sleep tonight.

In conclusion: Holy fuck.

name: gormster
text:
A quick measurement of that photo (knowing the entire contraption is 95 metres tall) gives that wheel at a whopping 25 metre diameter. That is the height of an eight-storey building.

Nightmares ahoy!

name: kelsotimebomb
text:
So this is what Beef meant when he was talking about huge apocalyptic machinery.

Gentlemen, we're about to get our shit all mowed down.

name: st_elmos_fire
text: exactly what I thought, exactly, surprised no one else said it earlier

name: kaithekender
text: Absolutely correct. That machine is fucking terrifying.

name: unfun
text: A comment left by unfun was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by autrepoupee, Neccos, Lereya)

name: twoply
text: That's why my lady was worshiped at Disney Paris. It all somewhat makes sense now. Still I haven't figured out why a fig is always 5 miles away from you at any point in France. It boggles the minds as such!

name: twoply
text: My first lame. I need some Marie Callender's before I get mad depressed.

name: alzuna
text: It's cool man, we've all been there....11 months later, did you get the chocolate one with the cookie crust? That is a depression clearer for sure.

name: twoply
text: Nope, I believe mince meat was my first choice. They had no idea what that was so I settled for banana cream.

name: pr0ncess
text:
I'm going to sound humourless and stuff but... that cliche is so untrue... in France, the women are far more obsessive about armpit hair than any other country I have lived in. If I had gone to high-school with armpit hair, the other girls would have left me shamed and whimpering in the girls' toilets.

HOWEVER, all the other stuff is true. Rudeness, swearing, smoking, ignoring you... spot on.

name: unfun
text: Is it possible that the obsessive armpit shaving is a reaction to that perception?  Like maybe if we keep making fun of the French for those other things, they will become extremely polite, attentive, clean-mouthed and smoke-free.

name: gormster
text: Non. Ze French are not here to fucking impress you. Zat ees just not French.

name: soticoto
text: A comment left by soticoto was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by sirhan_duran, 762, Doc_Rostov, tellumo, morbo)

name: gormster
text: Yeah you also have free dentists. They might not be great but over here in Australia we have to literally thousands of dollars to receive some torturous abuse from a stranger.

name: soticoto
text:
You assume I've seen one in the past decade?
My not having fillings might have something to do with that.

name: duskbringer
text: I can see Mean Girls on my television. Does that get me a part in BitchSeer2?

name: kickstart
text: only if them hooters can also predict the weather

name: unfun
text: Real Men of Genius: Mr. Bored-With-Wife-Machine Inventor

name: centipede_damascus
text: Kid Rock's limo is a motorhome. Seems about right.

name: padijun
text: my neighbors own a motorhome that must have cost double what my house did so don't bag on him just yet

name: rawk5tar
text: What's sad is that I didn't even realize 'loafs' is misspelled...

name: mastronaut
text:
The fact that Onstad doesn't acknowledge "baloney" is even better.

A.K.A. balogna

name: axhoola
text: A.A.K.A. bologna

name: solobuttons
text: Science Philippe is exceptionally cute.

name: andrew_
text:
a hundred times a second?

The science is blowing my god-damned mind!

name: skoora
text: Phillipe Times on a Monday? What kind of anarchy bullshit is this?

name: featurelessvoid
text: The whole schedule got shifted by a day when they ran the chicken recipe last week.

name: imitationcrab
text: Yeah.  On a Monday?  The only thing I could think was "BOO TO THAT."  Not really how I wanted to kick off the week.

name: aarongstock
text:
Thank goodness for title/alt text.

I had thought "loaves" was spelled "loafs" because Onstad isn't a follower of Tolkien.

name: geysershitdick
text:
You should be ashamed of yourself for making that joke.

I myself am now going to castrate myself for getting it.

name: nbgreene
text: dont even bother, seems like you wont be needing it anyway

name: robobogle
text: Don't worry, Phillipe. I give up too. I give up too...

name: johnnylandmine
text: I see that even his significantly-improved lot in life hasn't assuaged Beef's long-standing fear of [url=http://m.assetbar.com/achewood/one_strip?b=M%5ea11f09b8576e606bcb5038dfdb92fb821&u=http%3A%2F%2Fachewood.com%2Fcomic.php%3Fdate%3D05142002]"giant, apocalyptic machinery just mowing us all down."

name: johnnylandmine
text:
God damn it.

Let's try that again .

text:
the naked man returns !

i can certainly identify that man, my father is friends with a few of them.

text: brilliant find. I knew I recognized him, but I lack your gumption and research skills.

text: I did not mean to mark you as spam!  I AM NOT A COCK TO STRANGERS.

name: neonfreon
text: To be fair, it's just a Fleur-de-lis - it's not specific to the Saints. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fleur-de-lis

text: thank you for doing it before i did.

text: And thanks for doing it before I flipped my lid.

name: wae
text: Phillipe has discovered the "Wingdings" font?

name: soticoto
text: A comment left by soticoto was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by fosters, GeyserShitdick, smilebuddha, Doc_Rostov, tellumo)

name: fosters
text:
I like how you spazzed about him associating a French symbol with a foreign sports team and then did the EXACT SAME THING. The fleur-de-lis has about as much to do with an American football team as a Welsh rugby team.

Also, the word is fuck. Fuck fuck fuck. Why not just start saying "h-e-double hockey sticks" while you're at it?

name: soticoto
text: A comment left by soticoto was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by cunty, GeyserShitdick, ravindra108, tellumo)

name: fosters
text: The French also play football. In fact given the demographics of New Orleans I'd say the fleur de lis is more relevant to the Saints than anything to do with Wales. Congratulations on your epic failure of logic.

name: smilebuddha
text: Dangit.  Sorry for the lame, and I ran out of chubbies to offset.

name: olethros
text: I'm gonna have to guess he's a Peterbilt man.

name: boyd
text: In France, it is considered rude not to slap ice cream cones from the hands of wheelchair-bound children.

name: fantomeciel
text: Why is this a 3.1? there's so much great stuff in here. I cannot stop laughing at the BitchSeer.

name: andrew_
text:
because I hadn't given it a 4 at the time.

Now that I have, it is at 3.2!

name: molesticide
text: this strip totally abolishes all the pessimism i'd been having about the last few weeks.  marvelous.  impressively awesome.  my hat has exited the vicinity above me head- near my middle, it crumples only slightly as i bow in a courtly manner.

name: mastronaut
text: Tone and grammar lead me to believe that it is Lyle.

name: tombsgrave
text: SPACE AGE PHILLIPE!, The BitchSeer, and the wife-bored-with machine make this the best ever Friday Facts.  And it's on a Monday.

name: carrollhach
text: I'd be cautious about discussing Baloney Loaf around Lyle. He might come home with a parents' video called "KITCHEN MONKEY III: Baloney Loaf"

text: i laugh when i think of that naked man's picture and his words.

name: nonanon
text: Oh my gooooosh dude

name: wiliamthepleasr
text: Speaking of Kid Rock, today when I was trying to buy Jim Beam at the grocery store, I was thwarted by the fact that each bottle was in a box with Kid Rock on the outside. I share Ray's anger about packages, and wish Kid Rock would go off my liquor and back to his RV.
